website_summaries.verdict: Very low price for a simple climbing harness. Mesh materials will keep you cool while working out.
pros: Has a low price, but offers good build quality and can support more than 500 pounds
Easy harness to put on and secure
Doesn't contain a lot of extra clips or areas for storage, but low price makes up for that
Made mainly for inexperienced climbers seeking a low priced model to get started
cons: Lack of padding makes it uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic beginner's harness. Completely comfortable on descent. I've been away from climbing for over 10 years and this is perfect for me. I find myself climbing 5.7's. My climbing partner (5.9 climber, Devil's Tower in the spring) says it's the perfect starters harness until you know and find what you need. On a side note, it fits my 5 year old twins (boy & girl) with some tightening. Great harness!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners, or occasional use
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive harness is fine for the occasional use rappeler. I'm a 225 lb man and it served me well for both cave rappelling and canyoneering. That is to say, it fits comfortably, even on long 150' rappels, is durable in wet/muddy conditions, and kept me alive. It worked well in a multiple rappel slot canyon with 8 consecutive rappels. It was fine for caving descending/ascending short vertical shafts. PROS: Inexpensive Durable for occasional use Comfortable in the air, even on long rappels/decents CONS: The nylon attachment can collapse and bind when using multiple carabiners under load.
customer_reviews.author: flutterby42

customer_reviews.title: Works Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for tree climbing. This worked awesome!!!!! We had a lot of dead branches in our trees, and an Arborist wanted $2,000 to remove the dead for us. Instead, I purchased this and a heavy duty rope. Saved me $1950. I will definitely buy this again if needed!
customer_reviews.author: david guffy

customer_reviews.title: Well made and fairly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The harness is easy to get on and off, pretty comfortable, and definitely very well-made. I am a tall woman of size 8, so there is lots of excess webbing, but I am still able to cinch it down sufficiently. It works well for me as I am using this along with a short length of climbing rope and a sturdy carabiner to help stabilize me when working on a taller ladder and really am never suspended by the harness. I believe, however, as the loop in front nicely grabs upward, that it would work well as a climbing harness. All the connections and webbing are very sturdy with reinforced ends.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeelover

customer_reviews.title: But i personally don't like how the Black diamond ones scrunch you up with ...
customer_reviews.text: While this is more of a climbing harness, we used them as repelling harnesses down in southern Utah. It only has the one loop to connect to rather than the two that most Black Diamond Harnesses have. I would actually prefer this one over those because for one it is cheaper and you don't necessarily have to take it off for slots. But i personally don't like how the Black diamond ones scrunch you up with the double loop. I felt comfortable enough to do a 150' repel with this thing on.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbagump0258

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for caving
customer_reviews.text: We took our scouts to a nearby lava cave and lowered 8 scouts down 30ft into the cave then we hauled them back out when they were done. The same harness was easily put on each scout both to lower, then each scout put it on and easily cinched it tight to their different waists. One of our leaders (let's just say a 3XL) kind of guy used it as well. I just bought two more, I liked them so much. Just right for the part time caving enthusiast!
customer_reviews.author: David T. Nebeker

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: I needed to carry something with me from time to time to be able to climb places that I would need a safety harness or rope. This more than fit that bill. I've grown out in places that I shouldn't over the years, so needed something a bit larger than norm. This harness has done the job very well for me. I don't go out and climb the shear face of cliffs, but do occasionally climb somewhat steep areas that I need some extra safety.
customer_reviews.author: GLM in VA

customer_reviews.title: Roof Repair
customer_reviews.text: After over half a dozen roofers and a leaky roof remaining, my wife and I decided to try it ourselves (we can’t make it any worse, can we?). I purchased the harness, a rope, and a couple carabiners to provide a safety line while I’m on the roof. Removed flashing an fixed several leaks, one remains elusive, but I’ll get it too.
customer_reviews.author: Mithrandir's Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Great for gym climbing
customer_reviews.text: I'm a gym climber; when I first presented this harness for safety, I was scoffed at a bit, because it's not a $50+ harness. I've climbed in $50+ harnesses before, and let me just say that so long as you're not going to spend hours hanging in it, this works absolutely wonderfully. Fully and easily adjustable, looks pro, very pleased with this buy after 10+ hours of climbing in it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend  !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to climb a very steep roof. I attached a bracelet to the top of the roof so I could tie off on it and ascend down utilizing a rope and this safety harness. It's still a little scary working from a rope but this harness gives me the confidence needed to work safely.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Just doesn't remotely compare to a brand name climbing harness like Edelrid or Mammut. Both my husband and I found it terribly uncomfortable. For some reason, the harness doesn't provide adequate support in the leg loops so you can't comfortably sit in it when rappeling down and you feel all the pressure in your waist and hips. I gave it two stars because it's not an unsafe harness, just terribly uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent beginner harness
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the performance of this harness. I had to get two of these quick and cheap because we had to add two people at the last minute. Arrived quick and worked well. No issues. One of them got tested pretty well to, had a person in our party straight drop 25 feet to a hard stop. No tears.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Weidlich

customer_reviews.title: Great, One Size Fits All
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great all around safe harness. I only gave it 4 stars because it is rather uncomfortable. The added loop to hold your gear is one of the main reasons I picked this harness over other similar harnesses. It fit me 6' and also sized down to fit my 9 year old boy. It is definitely a universal fit.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect!!! And cheap!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cost effective harness! And it is one size fits all! I got it since I am a beginner at climbing and it works great!!! My tip, get your climbing gear on Amazon and then find your shoes at a lightly used sports equipment store! Best way to get effective gear for a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For climbing... Or gutter cleaning!
customer_reviews.text: So, I'm no climber - I'm a DIYer. This harness is what I use to clean my gutters. I've attached a D-ring VERY securely to the crest of the roof and using this harness and rope, I am able to clean out the gutters with relative ease.
customer_reviews.author: Ezell house

customer_reviews.title: Bad knee and fell into the creek enough
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great-good quality- NO I am not rock climbing. Lowering myself down hill to edge weeds and growth. Bad knee and fell into the creek enough. Got the how to tie knots for the equipment. 3 metal pole hammered into ground. Loop the rope lower away. At 75 this is as good as it gets good equipment
customer_reviews.author: Hal Gnats

customer_reviews.title: One size fits most!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner harness. It does not have any padding so it is not that comfortable to wear for a long time if repelling. It is almost a universal fit. One size fits most! I have had kids as young as 3 and adults in this harness. Does great for all sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Fits a wide range of body types
customer_reviews.text: Great, easy to set up and use harness! We're a family that ranges from 6", 165lbs down to 3.5" 40lbs. It adjusted to all of us easy enough. From tree climbing to zip lining, it meets all our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Anm8tor

customer_reviews.title: Simple and basic harness
customer_reviews.text: It’s a simple to use basic climbing harness. Looks good and and works as intended. It’s not exactly comfortable but not designed to be. Definitely suitable for a beginner climber.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the price was cheap but it doesn't tighten as much as I would like and it doesn't stay as tight. Might as well buy a better one if you are going to climb. Overall it was ok. I give it 3 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good harness at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Good harness at an excellent price. Reasonably comfortable with wide webbing. Few bells and whistles, but it fits a WIDE range of body sizes (it's rescue harness after all). This makes it good for a family or for growing kids, where it needs to fit everyone at one time or another. Most useful indoors where you don't need to hang a rack of gear from the harness, since it only has one accessory loop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine, inexpensive  harness.
customer_reviews.text: Just fine if you need an inexpensive 2nd harness. Easy to figure out and will fit almost anyone. Only negative is there isn't really a place to clip in quickdraws/chalk/daisy chain, etc. But for a basic harness to have laying around so that a newbie can climb with you, this works.
customer_reviews.author: Chuckansas

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if certification is needed to use
customer_reviews.text: My climbing gym did not allow me to use them because they say they’re not certified. I didn’t have any actual problem with them. It would help to get more clarity on certifications in the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Nico St

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness, Not one size fits all
customer_reviews.text: Never got a chance to use this harness. It looks and feels very sturdy, however, when I received it it was way too big. Now, I weigh 180lbs, and when tightening the webbing, the strap went clear across my waist. Anyone smaller than me would not be able to use it. All my friends are smaller then me. So, if you are a bigger person, 200+, I'm sure it would work great, but just so you know, it is not one size fits all.
customer_reviews.author: Frietz

customer_reviews.title: A different use for a climbing harness
customer_reviews.text: This harness works great for the lift in my Tiny House On Wheels! I am disabled and needed a way to get up and down from the lofts without having to climb a ladder or stairs. This harness works really well with the hoist I have.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzmom

customer_reviews.title: Used this to go indoor rock climbing and it secured ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this to go indoor rock climbing and it secured me very well. Then I used it to secure me while I was on the roof cutting tree limbs and replacing shingles. Also, used this when I climbed a tree in the front yard, also using spikes, to take trim the tree, and I have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: k s 4 2 4 4

customer_reviews.title: Where is the UIAA and CE certification?
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware (with your life in this case) with this harness. UIAA 105 or the European Committee for Standardization EN 1277 are applicable and this harness has not passed them. And its labeled impact force <= 6kN. Dynamic climbing ropes are designed to keep fall impact forces below 11kN. Does this mean the harness fails in high force falls or belays?
customer_reviews.author: Barb W

customer_reviews.title: ... harness for an indoor rock climbing gym and I love it. I find it just as comfortable as ...
customer_reviews.text: Both my bf and I are using this harness for an indoor rock climbing gym and I love it. I find it just as comfortable as the most expensive ones, although my bf finds the padded ones more comfortable. For the price it is incredibly good - if you are an into rock climber I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole G.

customer_reviews.title: Does not instill confidence.
customer_reviews.text: Great if you plan on climbing a few times a year. Aside from that, this is not a very well made harness. It is very thin material and does not instill confidence in the user. If you plan on climbing more than a couple times a month, spend a little extra and get something nicer. I highly doubt this harness has the durability for frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Less comfortable and more digging in vs other harnesses of this style.
customer_reviews.text: Tried a couple times and am not able to get leg loops to take any pressure, so waist strap really digs in and can't really "sit" in the harness with any comfort. Seems like this is because the sections connecting waist to leg loops are too long, and that problem would be worse when using it for people of smaller size as advertised (down to 15" waist apparently). Have used other rental-style harnesses and have not had this issue with other harnesses.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff S

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently started a rock climbing gym (indoors) and got this to use on my own. When dangling by a piece of rope you want your equipment to work. THIS WORKS! it also comes with a little bag to store the harness in. I can even add a few carabiners and a descender in the bag with room to spare. *I weigh 165 - 5'5"
customer_reviews.author: Skydreams

customer_reviews.title: great for rappelling
customer_reviews.text: I use this more for rappelling than I do my actual EdelRidge climbing harness that far more expensive. Great as a back up because its a universal fit, It is easier to attach to my bag than my climbing harness. Great spare harness.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not too comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fairly lightweight person, around 150lbs. It works and seems well made, maybe I'm not using it correctly but it's just not comfortable when hanging from the tree....
customer_reviews.author: domainxh

customer_reviews.title: The harness is fine. The safety strap has a manufacturer date of ...
customer_reviews.text: The harness is fine. The safety strap has a manufacturer date of 1/2016 and it is to be replaced after 2 years from the manufacturer date.....good for just over 3 months!!!
customer_reviews.author: DALE R. FORBES

customer_reviews.title: Great but a bit large
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for climbing for a couple of months. Works well but is a bit big for me (28 waist)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad harness especially for the price but not the most comfortable or easiest to put on.
customer_reviews.author: 10GritSandpaper

customer_reviews.title: Still alive
customer_reviews.text: Been climbing with it for like 5 month now and yeah.. Im still here so I guess it holds up, right? That's kinda the whole point. It's cheap, it holds, it protects your huevos and that's not sexist because girls have eggs too so I'm looking forward if this review gets approved.
customer_reviews.author: EdgardoJCotto

customer_reviews.title: Decent, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Secure locking buckles; sits above the waist so you won't capsize; affordable; carrying bag to keep clean and tangle free. Cons: No padding; metal buckle at waist digs into hip bone when climbing or bending.
customer_reviews.author: Gunther2010

customer_reviews.title: Excellent harness...
customer_reviews.text: Very, Very nice harness. Great stitching, looks and feels very safe and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok harness (not ideal for rock climbing)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it for climbing at a local indoor rock wall / gym and I didn't feel too secure using it. I ended up purchasing a different harness that was more durable and comfortable. I imagine if you are doing tree work or only need a harness to use for a day, then this would be ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Joel S.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and they stay on.
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable, I am pushing the limit near 250 pounds, but I would be dead if I had not been harnessed in, more than once. If I have to do a lot of walking between climbing points, I use a set of suspenders.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Useless product. Wanted to return after expert climbers told me I should never use this. But return window was over. Doesn’t stay tight around my waist. Leg loops are weird too. Don’t buy for ur own safety
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a first harness
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure there are other harnesses but for my daughter (age 14), this was perfect. Pays for itself quickly compared to renting at the local climbing wall.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in MO

customer_reviews.title: Rugged construction.
customer_reviews.text: Have not used yet but, in my opinion it is rugged construction. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: but pretty uncomfortable whenever descending
customer_reviews.text: Is what it is. Reliable harness, but pretty uncomfortable whenever descending. No padding on the straps, but for the price, to be expected. I might drop another $20 and get one with a bit more cushion because this one has cut into me pretty hard on a couple of occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin W Dransfield

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a professional climber by any means, but this gets the job done. It feels secure and safe and got good marks at the rock gym.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Value for the money. Been using at local park for rock climbing and it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: product review

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and safe
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a safety harness while installing a window on the second floor, working on a rickety scaffolding. Worked great. Easy to adjust and to put on / take off.
customer_reviews.author: TallPaul

customer_reviews.title: Nice, functional and great price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve now bought 2 of these harnesses. It costs $2 every time we go to the rec center to rent a harness. These have already paid for themselves and I swear they’re even better than the ones the rec center rents out. (The climbing teacher recommended this very harness)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Richards

customer_reviews.title: I didnt fall out of it
customer_reviews.text: we are not serious climbers by any means. we go to the rock gym with the kids to them play and we didnt want to keep renting a harness. We mostly use them to belay the 40 and 50lbs kids. we have used them a coulpe time for our own little climbs. I didnt fall out of it so i guess it worked. as far as comfort i have nothing to compare them to.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Moore

customer_reviews.title: a little bigger for my  year old son but still works very well
customer_reviews.text: it works very well , a littler bit big for my 7 year old son but will last until he grow up. strong and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: i used as fall harness for roof work.
customer_reviews.text: worked well i do not know how much repelling i would do with it but for fall harness its all good.
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: Great value compared to other harnesses
customer_reviews.text: I have used this harness top-roping several times now, and I trust it. Great value compared to other harnesses. The fit is nice, too, since the leg straps sit firmly on my upper thigh rather than putting all the pressure on my sac.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler M. Mayberry

customer_reviews.title: Right for the price. Sharp edges dig in to ...
customer_reviews.text: Right for the price. Sharp edges dig in to your flesh. Would give it 2 stars for comfort, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I weight 250 lbs. and it works great for me.
customer_reviews.text: I weight 250 lbs. and it works great for me. I took it into the climbing gym to try it out and it was perfect. Very strong
customer_reviews.author: Stan Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good harness. Put over 300 pounds into once and held just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable when all your weight it applied. But it is very sturdy and secure. It took me pretty well with gear (+-100kg).
customer_reviews.author: Roan

customer_reviews.title: No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.text: Works good so far. I am new at this so I can't give any sort of expert opinion but I am happy with it. Price is quite reasonable too.
customer_reviews.author: GaryM

customer_reviews.title: Great harness....
customer_reviews.text: Got this because I had to do some work on my roof, and it's very comfortable and easy to use. Great harness.
customer_reviews.author: WMF

customer_reviews.title: Good value. I am using this as a safety ...
customer_reviews.text: Good value. I am using this as a safety when I go to the roof or on the ladder to trim tall palm trees. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Sunder Nadarajah

customer_reviews.title: as good or better than the 95
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, as good or better than the 95.00 harness I got last year. Buying several more to put back for the future while the price is so low.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Product works great, was a bit stiff at first, much more comfortable that my other safety harness. Order arrived earlier than the EDD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I AM 80 WHILE NAPPING IN TREE STAND I DID NOT FALL OUT
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fall out of my tree stand during hunting season
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Competent and exc. value
customer_reviews.text: Basic and competent harness.Represents excellent value.I will use to go up on my roof to clean out gutter once/twice yearly.
customer_reviews.author: PETER T.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for new climbers
customer_reviews.text: Does what we expected at a good value. Making it fit smaller people leaves an awkward "tail". We liked it enough to buy a 2nd one.
customer_reviews.author: P. Munroe

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, about the same as a rental
customer_reviews.text: It's about the same harness as my local climbing wall uses for rentals, so it was exactly what I was looking for in an inexpensive beginner harness.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great harness. The one issue one of my friends mentioned when we was resting for a prolonged period was that the harnes was digging into his thighs. I told him that was expected as there is no padding.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Well made, and works for my need for climbing tree.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chieng

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Harness!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent harness. Very high quality. Totally worth the $22! Made me feel safe while working on my icy roof last night. Might have to get the more expensive model next! Thanks Oumers!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Degeneffe

customer_reviews.title: easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: Well built . . . easy to put on. . . comfortable to wear. I'm not climbing rocks. I'm using it as a safety harness while working on the roof of my house.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Great costume
customer_reviews.text: We used this for a Halloween costume and it was great. The quality seems dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor J.

customer_reviews.title: Good harness
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Perfect for a one size fits all harness
customer_reviews.author: R_setnar

customer_reviews.title: A great, solid, well-made harness
customer_reviews.text: This is a harness for our son who loves to climb - we are thankful that it is high quality and gives us the assurance that he is secure. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Powers

customer_reviews.title: I really like this.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the balance between freedom of movement and having some protection against a fall.
customer_reviews.author: I used to use electric

customer_reviews.title: Good product, slightly uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Fits and keeps me safe. my only complaint is that it is sometimes uncomfortable and causes my leggings to chafe.
customer_reviews.author: tearbiscuits

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected at a great price! Use this for climbing into caves and caverns.
customer_reviews.author: Wildlifer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I would have a spare to loan out for other people. I haven’t used it myself. But my friends have and it worked well for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet. I used to climb, but I bought it as a safety device.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Well made, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Yup, exactly what I wanted. Great for peace of mind when climbing in dangerous areas or on tall objects (Trees). Be sure to check your carabiners tho!
customer_reviews.author: Butterscotch lollies

customer_reviews.title: Good equipment, says crazyclam
customer_reviews.text: Great starter equipment Would have gave 5 stars but scared me when first try on and adjustment. One size fits me to 3 of me, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Crazyclamme@yahoo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and comfortable. I have a tree service and this was my first harness, did great and trust it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well-made & sturdy, adjustments are simple, harness is comfortable when worn.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good gear for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't actually climbed with it but test it out for comfort and strength and am very happy with the feel and fit. Can hang for long periods without discomfort. Will use it for tree trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Mccord

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this to anyone interested
customer_reviews.text: This product exceeded my expectations for quality and performance. I would highly recommend this to anyone interested.
customer_reviews.author: AUTOBOB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price and the application. I used it for working on a roof.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy P. McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My tiny 9 year old can wear this. It is more than large enough for me (Dad).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is not as comfortable as I would like
customer_reviews.text: It is not as comfortable as I would like, but it is good for an entry level harness.It is great for occasional use, in my case, I use it for climbing the mast of my sailboat. I would recommend it for a starter belt or occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: David Jones

customer_reviews.title: The straps connecting waistband to legs feel too long, ...
customer_reviews.text: The straps connecting waistband to legs feel too long, causing waistband to hike up as you are lowered off the wall. Also the waist strap is way too long, dangling behind my back.
customer_reviews.author: paloalto

customer_reviews.title: Did the job at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. I did some work on my steep pitched roof and felt very secure. My use was limited and did the job at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: BLeB

customer_reviews.title: Great harness
customer_reviews.text: I used this learning how to rappell. It is comfortable, easy to use, and works great. Great harness for beginners who don't want to spend alot on a harness
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Our family have used these on the indoor climbing wall. They fit well on all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis A

customer_reviews.title: Used as lift belt for my mother in wheelchair!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than just a medical lift belt because it can't slip up. My mother felt safer transferring to and from her wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: GA Redhead

customer_reviews.title: For the price, its a very well made product ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price,its a very well made product. If it saves my ass from bouncing off the ground I'll give it seven stars. I need to use it when I top off 1 tree in my back yard.
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Made me feel Safe
customer_reviews.text: Bought it so I could be secure while working on the roof of Gazebo a Scout was building for his Eagle Scout Project. Worked as advertised. Good quality construction.
customer_reviews.author: Senatorii

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, bought because I was painting dormers on my house not a fan of heights
customer_reviews.author: joe wilkins

customer_reviews.title: We were going on a hike in a slot canyon ...
customer_reviews.text: We were going on a hike in a slot canyon hat required a short repel and needed something that would adjust to everyone in our group. This fit the bill perfectly for that. We had from 10 year old kids to large adults and this worked for all.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Niebergall

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money. Fast shipping. Compact design. Easy to throw in a Daypack.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. This harness does everything that I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Conley

customer_reviews.title: Nice item
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for light climbing. I really like how adjustable it is.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Good harness overall... Would use on lead or to roping
customer_reviews.text: Good harness... Not the best. Perfectly advertised. Fits myself and my 7 year old. Nice overall
customer_reviews.author: Tsohg

customer_reviews.title: plenty of adjustment
customer_reviews.text: The harness came in as described and has plenty of adjustment for larger person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Climbing Harness, Oumers Safe Seat Belts for Mountaineering Tree Climbing Outdoor Training Caving Rock Climbing Rappelling Equip - Half Body Guide Harness Protect Waist Safety Harness for Women Man
product_meta.description:
Women Man Child Half Body Climbing Harness

Why Oumers: 
Oumers INC. mainly engaged in the development and export of outdoor products. Products of high quality, stylish design. 
Oumers has always adhered to " High quality products, good customer experience" business purposes. 
Committed to providing you with high-quality products and quality services.

Description:
Reinforced Buckle---It is firm and the weight has been tested.
Bearing Loop--It is the unbroken belt with reinforced loops. So it can bear your weight. It is fit properly, and appropriate to the type of climbing you’re doing.
For rock climbing and mountaineering. Climbing is dangerous. You are responsible for your own actions and decisions. Familarize yourself with this harness's capabilities and limitations.
We recommed every climber seek qualified instruction. Please have all equipment safety checked by a qualified professional prior to use. 
Extensive Use: 
1.You can choose this safety harness in the park for outdoor activity with your family.
2.You can choose this climbing harness in climbing gym or camp activity
For the Work Demands 
It may be dangerous for your family member to work on the high place. A safety harness may keep you safety and let your family feel relieved.

SAFETY AND QUALITY IS MOST IMPORTANT FOR OUMERS CLIMBING HARNESS.

Warm Prompt:
If you receive the item with any problems, please contact us at the first time, you will get the best after-service. We will do our best to help until this is fully resolved. Have a good time!
feature_bullets: Beginner's harness, basic harness - tension≥15KN, impact force≤6KN, safety first, CE certified, ISO9001 certified. Half body climbing harness you can trust
Safe harness fit for person (waist 15" to 48" , Leg 10" to 31.5" ) - comfortable to wear, and easy to adjust, polyester materials
This half body harness has high load bearing, all the connections and webbing are very sturdy with reinforced ends to protect your safety at all times
Wide range of uses - perfecting for tree climbing, tree service indoor climbing, outdoor training, comfortable cushioning to ensure safety during application
100% Satisfaction Guarantee, we guarantee to provide customers with best product &service. Any climbing harness issues, we are very happy to either provide a Refund or a Replacement!
